Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_705936
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Use of this reporting template is optional and is not required for accreditation purposes. The template can be used for benign and borderline phyllodes tumors, but pathologic stage classification should only be done for those tumors classified as malignant.

ListItem.name: LI_592852
ListItem.title: Total mastectomy (including nipple-sparing and skin-sparing mastectomy)

ListItem.name: LI_592871
ListItem.title: Specify distance from nipple in Centimeters (cm)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_592888
DisplayedItem.title: A diagnosis of malignant phyllodes tumor requires the presence of all five of the following features: marked stromal cellularity, marked stromal atypia, stromal overgrowth, an infiltrative tumor border and greater than or equal to 10 mitoses per 10 high power fields (HPFs). Tumors should be classified as borderline when some but not all of these changes are present. Malignant phyllodes tumor is also diagnosed when malignant heterologous elements other than pure well differentiated liposarcoma are present, even if not all of the other histologic features of malignancy are observed.

ListItem.name: LI_592894
ListItem.title: Mild (minimal variation in nuclear size, even chromatin, and smooth nuclear contours)

ListItem.name: LI_592895
ListItem.title: Moderate (more variation in nuclear size and irregular nuclear membranes)

ListItem.name: LI_592896
ListItem.title: Marked (marked nuclear pleomorphism, hyperchromasia, and irregular nuclear contours)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_593043
DisplayedItem.title: Stromal overgrowth is present when there is at least one low-power microscopic field (4x objective and 10x eyepiece or 22.9 mm2) that contains stroma only without epithelial elements.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_592904
DisplayedItem.title: Malignant phyllodes tumors have greater than or equal to 10 mitoses per 10 high-power fields (40x objective and 10x eyepiece) or greater than or equal to 5 mitoses / mm2. Benign phyllodes tumors have less than 5 mitoses per 10 HPFs (less than 2.5 mitoses / mm2).

ListItem.name: LI_592903
ListItem.title: Specify number of mitoses per 10 high power fields

ListItem.name: LI_592906
ListItem.title: Specify number of mitoses per square Millimeter (mm)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_592910
DisplayedItem.title: A circumscribed border is smooth and well-defined or shows a minimally irregular tumor interface with adjacent stroma. Infiltrative (permeative) tumor borders can be focally infiltrative (unequivocal invasion into adjacent stroma in one low power field) or extensively infiltrative (unequivocal invasion in a wide area or in multiple foci along the tumor periphery).

DisplayedItem.name: DI_592917
DisplayedItem.title: A phyllodes tumor is regarded as malignant when there are malignant heterologous elements, even when not all of the other histological features of malignancy are present. This rule does not apply if the only heterologous element is well differentiated liposarcoma. In the breast, those tumors usually lack MDM2 and CDK4 amplifications and have a low metastatic risk. A diagnosis of malignant phyllodes tumor should therefore not be based solely on the presence of well-differentiated liposarcoma without all of the other histologic features of malignancy.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_592925
DisplayedItem.title: Margin status is listed as positive if there is ink on phyllodes tumor (i.e., the distance is 0 mm)

ListItem.name: LI_592924
ListItem.title: All margins negative for phyllodes tumor

Question.name: Q_592935
Question.title: Distance from Phyllodes Tumor to Closest Margin

ListItem.name: LI_592959
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_593046
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_593047
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph nodes

Question.name: Q_593048
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Section.name: S_592992
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note G)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_592993
DisplayedItem.title: Staging applies only to malignant phyllodes tumors. pT and pN categories should not be assigned for benign and borderline tumors.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_592993_1
Property.val: Staging applies only to malignant phyllodes tumors. pT and pN categories should not be assigned for benign and borderline tumors.

Question.name: Q_592997
Question.title: ?Pathologic Stage Classification (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (required only if the tumor is malignant)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_592998
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_593005
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable (tumor is not graded as malignant)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_705937
DisplayedItem.title: The following section applies only if the tumor is malignant. Do not assign pT and pN stage categories for benign or borderline tumors.

ListItem.name: LI_593015
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_593016
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_593017
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_593018
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor more than 5 cm but not more than 10 cm

ListItem.name: LI_593019
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor more than 10 cm but not more than 15 cm

ListItem.name: LI_593020
ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor more than 15 cm in greatest dimension

DisplayedItem.name: DI_593025
DisplayedItem.title: When no lymph nodes are present, the pathologic 'N' category is not assigned (pNX is not used and should not be reported)

ListItem.name: LI_593026
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_593027
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_769535
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_593031
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_593031_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

ListItem.name: LI_593038
ListItem.title: Fibroepithelial proliferation (coexisting fibroadenoma or fibroadenomatoid change in the tissue surrounding the phyllodes tumor)
